website_summaries.verdict: While the Melitta 10-Cup Thermal Coffeemaker is a cheap way to get your morning Joe in a thermal carafe, its bitter brew makes it hard to recommend.
pros: Priced at a budget-minded $69, the Melitta 10-Cup Thermal Coffeemaker offers automatic drip coffee when you need it and a vacuum-sealed carafe to keep it hot for hours
cons: The 10-Cup Thermal Coffeemaker takes a long time to brew, and what it produces is bitter, not rich or smooth
The Melitta's water indicator is tricky to read, and its plastic parts feel flimsy, not high quality

customer_reviews.title: Despite a minor issue this is the best coffee maker I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Makes great coffee. Unlike my three previuos thermal drip pots, this one never clogs causing coffee to spill all over my counter top while brewing. The only annoyance is that the design of the spout on the pot is such that if you pour faster than a trickle, coffee dribbles down the front of the pot and collects on the stand. The dried coffee residue will build up on the stand plate giving it a corroded appearance. I have been using my first Melitta 46894 for about 10 years and it is still going strong. I purchased this one as a gift for my daughter and she is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: T Wagster

customer_reviews.title: I love this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker. It makes good, hot java in a very well-insulated carafe. The pour-interrupt (or whatever it's called, that lets you pour while coffee is still brewing) feature works very well compared with other units I've had. My only complaints, which are minor, are that (1) the water level gauge only shows water level above 6 cups, so it's useless for determining when the pot is almost done, and (2) there is only one such gauge, on the right hand side, which in my case is not easily visible. The carafe fits snugly into place and doesn't allow sloppy placement leading to messy spills. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lumpy

customer_reviews.title: It's junk and I would never buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: The coating on the burner is wearing off and the metal is being exposed. This started happening just as the window to return it expired. This is the worst coffee maker I've ever had, it's only a couple of months old and this is happening. What a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Florine Francis

customer_reviews.title: Best traditional coffeemaker on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Melitta after reading tons of reviews of this and others. This is by far the best traditional coffeemaker out there. Uses a cone filter and brews delicious coffee. The unit is sleek-looking and well-built. The display is minimalist and the button controls are zero-frill, and I like it that way. The thermal carafe keeps coffee HOT for literally hours - perfect for lazy mornings. It's nice for entertaining too... Just set the carafe on the table. The lid unscrews for full access to clean the inside of the pot. Considering the price of quality carafes alone, you are practically getting the coffeemaker free!
customer_reviews.author: mkim309

customer_reviews.title: Good features; good coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a similar Starbucks Barista model we used daily for 9 years. Having tried many different brands over the years the thermal carafe with the cone filter is our favorite. The Melitta is easy to fill with coffee and water. The brew is hot and robust. The one curiosity is that even though this is a thermal carafe the plate underneath gets hot to the touch during brewing. Melitta makes an identical model with a glass carafe that needs to stay hot on the bottom while this version should not. I suspect either a model mixup or a surprising design change. Too soon to tell if the reliability will match the Starbucks model.
customer_reviews.author: ALF Engineer

customer_reviews.title: A Gem!
customer_reviews.text: I was not familiar with Melitta before making this purchase. But when my old $200 Bunn died, I had to do something. I wanted a thermal pot to keep the coffee tasting fresh and the gizmo had to be simple. The reviews here praise Melitta, so I thought I had little to lose. Quite frankly, the coffee maker has surpassed my expectations. The robust setting makes my coffee taste great, the thermal pot keeps the coffee hot, and it is just about as simple as it gets. The only downside seems to be that the coating on the heating pad is peeling away. Still, if this lost-cost maker lasts half as long as my old Bunn, I'll be quite happy.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not the best part of waking up.
customer_reviews.text: The top of the carafe doesn't seal. So, even though it's a nice double walled vessel, all of the heat escapes out the top. Also, two out of the 5 times I tried using this maker, coffee would stop flowing into the carafe during the brewing process and spill all over the counter. After investigation, I found that a bubble would get stuck in the hole where the coffee was supposed to enter the pot. The bubbles stopped the coffee from flowing through, and hot coffee would build up on the top of the pot and begin to spill over the sides and everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fermenich

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and Functional
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker is perfect for everyday use. The thermal carafe works very nicely if you are drinking coffee over several hours. The quality of the coffee it brews is fine. We are heavy coffee drinkers. The appearance is a polished stainless steel that fits in well with some higher end appliances we have in our kitchen. The coffee pot definitely does not look cheap. We have more expensive Krups coffee pots in another residence but so far like this one better. It looks nicer and seems to run more smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: ROB IV

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many, many pots looking for one that would not only brew a great cup of coffee but also pour without dripping. This pot is perfect on both counts. It is easy to clean and use. I know I won't wake up to coffee all over the counter from some coffee maker issue and I really love the brew strength feature. Excellent! The thermal pot keeps the coffee at a reasonable drinking temperature though for some folks who like their brew extra hot, it may not be quite hot enough. I appreciate not having to worry about shutting it off and so does my boss since I never have to run home to turn off the coffee pot anymore.
customer_reviews.author: D.E.Green

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: We have only had it for a couple weeks, but this is, so far, outstanding. Other reviews led me to buy this unit, and we are impressed. We had bought a Mr. Coffee earlier that cost more than this, ran water all over the counter every time, and made very weak coffee This one does everything right. The cone filter gets good strong coffee with a minimum of grounds. It has a great carafe, keeping beverage hot a long time. It has three settings for regular, bold and robust coffee, and it works like a real winner. I hope it lasts a long time. Starting out, this is the best coffee maker I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Paulus

customer_reviews.title: Brews fantastic coffee, But you need to buy a new one every year!
customer_reviews.text: You couldn't ask for a better brewing system. And for the price this is excellent. Brewing temp is perfect. There are three levels of robustness. It is easy to clean. The brewing water temp is perfect to extract the best flavor from the coffee, unlike Mr moffee and others that aren't able to get this right. There is a warming element under the carraffe that rusts out within a year to year and a half. I have bought 6 of these so far replacing earlier ones that have rusted out. But, this makes such an awesome cup of coffee that it is well worth the $50 or so per year to replace it with another.
customer_reviews.author: LesF

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Best brewer I've ever used. It is quick and quiet and makes really hot coffee. The thermal carafe keeps the coffee hot for hours. The controls are intuitive. I programmed it without the manual. A very strong point is that the electronics are physically located in the top of the machine. The maker I had prior to this had the electronics in the bottom under the carafe. I had a senior moment and ran the machine without the carafe in place, made a mess and flooded the electronics and killed a $200 coffee maker. At least with this one I'll only feel stupid and have to clean up the mess if that happens again.
customer_reviews.author: Olslewfoot

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace an old Hamilton Beach Stay/Go Coffee Maker that had a glass carafe. After reading the reviews this seemed like the most affordable option. I did notice in the reviews about the puddling and noticed that there are two holes in the back of the water reservoir so you must not overfill. It brews good coffee and has the three settings and we brew on the Bold setting and find it to be perfect. Like the stainless steel carafe over the glass and the opening is larger than the one on the Stay/Go so easier to scrub. Overall very happy with the purchase and can recommend.
customer_reviews.author: coloradogal

customer_reviews.title: Ok-Joe!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, easy, and makes a great pot of coffee! The heating element is on only while the unit makes coffee, after it's done brewing, the heater turns off and the thermal carafe holds temperature for quite a few hours... Contrary to the description of this product, it does have a heater under the thermal carafe, it is just managed correctly. Never burned coffee again! This is my 3rd Melitta coffee maker, the other two were the grind-and-brew models that have been discontinued,(loved that maker). No trouble so far, but only into the brewing for a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Zunky

customer_reviews.title: Okay coffee. Unit leaks every time we use it.
customer_reviews.text: This unit makes decent coffee, though a bit weak even on the strongest setting. The low rating is due to the fact that it leaks water (not coffee) out of the bottom of the unit. There are two small holes in the bottom of the coffee maker from which the water seems to flow. (I can pick up the unit and see the water coming out.) The one time I used the timed/programmed setting, about 1/3 of the water in the reservoir leaked onto the counter overnight before it even began brewing. We didn't have time to contact Amazon during the 30-day return window, so I've emailed Melitta customer service to ask about a return.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but the thermal feature does not work well.... =(
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get a thermal coffee maker. I assumed this would be the kind of thermos that could keep coffee piping hot for hours like the description hints toward but it does not do that at all. It's really just a low end coffee maker posing as a thermal model. My Stanley Thermos does a better job than this thing... Very disappointing. I've had this coffee maker for about 8 months and am stuck with it for now. PROS: It makes coffee at three strengths so that's cool CONS: Thermal feature sucks... really doesn't work well unfortunately. Maybe try a higher end model.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Its Ok
customer_reviews.text: I chose this particular cofee maker because the pot is made of steel and therefore unbreakable. What I find unsatisfactory however is the impracticality of the way the pot-cover was configurated as it would not allow you to empty the pot completely. The temperature also is luke-warm not hot, which in itself disappoints. This could have been a Great Coffee maker but whoever made the decision focused more on the aesthetics than functionality. It should have focused instead on making a cofee maker first then building a design around it; not the other way around.
customer_reviews.author: Oni Sioson

customer_reviews.title: keeps tasty coffee warm for hours
customer_reviews.text: Pros I never meet a coffee maker I liked -- except this one: stylish, ruggedly built, simple to operate, and it keeps the coffee warm for many hours. It is an exquisite piece of design engineering, a handsome addition to the kitchen counter. Cons As mentioned in another review, the hotplate has started rusting after six months. The pause & served valve failed after six months, leaking coffee all over the counter. Replacing the cheap washer on this valve required a trip to the hardware store and $1.98 for a *real* washer to fix it!
customer_reviews.author: PMD3669

customer_reviews.title: Like the Robust setting
customer_reviews.text: We have found the robust setting makes the best coffee, since it is slow drip...the regular is not bad, but the bold is better. So good, better, best are the descriptions I have for the regular, bold, robust settings. The thermal carafe keeps coffee hot and not bitter, for hours. I am ready to replace my overpriced Bunn for this one at my other house. I also bought the matching coffee grinder which is awesome...one touch to turn on and it turns off when it's done and it looks just like this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: JM2

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker, great coffee
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this coffee maker and I am fussy about my coffee. The Braun cone filter electric coffee maker I had loved for years finally died and needed to be replaced. So I researched other cone filter coffee makers and decided on this Melita with the thermal carafe. Wow, I wish I hadn't waited so long to replace the old one. This makes delicious coffee, ready when you get up, works great, and keeps the coffee warm without burning it for about an hour. You can adjust the strength as well (I crank it up and it makes the coffee as strong as I like it).
customer_reviews.author: catwomando

customer_reviews.title: Great...If It Didn't Leak But FANTASTIC Support
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was special, ignored the warnings about the leaking and ordered one anyway. After a couple weeks it started to leak. Called Hamilton Beach who services and makes Melitta products. A tech who knew my machine inside and out (and had it on her desk to help with support calls) gave me three things to try to stop the leaking (NOTE: I asked to troubleshoot before getting a replacement for ecological reasons). The bottom line is that everything needs to be lined up precisely. Tech support: 877-293-9091
customer_reviews.author: JH Easton

customer_reviews.title: This machine makes good coffee, but burner rusts
customer_reviews.text: I am a light coffee drinker, but I can tell the difference with this machine. Coffee is smoother and tastes better to me. Thermal pot is great when you have company over, just set it in the middle of the table. After having this product for 6 months I have found that the burner gets rusty. I have not used any abrasives or abused in any way. Update: I contacted Melitta (Hamilton Beach) about the rusty burner. They sent me a new coffee maker. I had to pay 14.99 shipping but good to get rid of the rust.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Cup
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three of these coffee makers, 2 as gifts and one for myself. The 2 recipients have informed me how much their daily "cup of Joe" has improved. I know my coffee has never tasted better. Best of all is the thermal carafe which keeps the coffee hot for hours without the burned taste coffee in a glass carafe gets when sitting on a hot burner. I also appreciate the safety feature of not having to worry about leaving the coffee maker on when I leave the house in a hurry since the burner never heats up.
customer_reviews.author: lovedogs

customer_reviews.title: Very good coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the thermal coffeemakers for a number of years simply because I do not like my coffee to taste burned, as in glass. I received my purchase about two weeks ago, and I love it. I have purchsed the cheaper brands and the so called high end units. This Melitta performs well, looks good, and provides a great cup of coffee with no change to proportions for me. Only time will tell if it is durable. I would reccomend highly at this point. The price was certainly economical. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ldun

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a GREAT Coffeemaker!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this Melitta coffeemaker. Within the last year I purchased two different Cuisinart coffeemakers and had to return them immediately, as they did not keep the coffee hot. My Melitta not only keeps the coffee nice and hot, but it also makes very good coffee. Before purchasing this particular model, I studied many Amazon customer reviews, which were very helpful. So to sum it up, if you want delicious, hot coffee, purchase this model.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Where Have You Been!!
customer_reviews.text: ...once in a while when you are looking for a replacement you have the good fortune of exceeding expectations...this is my experience with the Melitta Thermal Coffeemaker...easy to use..easy to clean up...elegant to look at...first time people have complimented me for great coffee and the beauty of the coffee maker..!!.. Update: 08/25/13 ...still making great coffee however: base of main unit is rapidly losing black coating and beginning to show rust...not sure of cause...clean/dry unit each day before storage...with this manufacturing defect I have to lower my rating to 4-stars...
customer_reviews.author: E. Dell

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Tastes good
customer_reviews.text: Some have said here that the coffee is not hot enough. If you like your coffee too hot to drink when you pour it, they may have a point. I temped the coffee seconds after it completed and found it to be 175 degrees. My Bunn was 195 or so when completed but too hot to drink right away. I like my coffee on the strong side and the Melitta (Hamilton Beach) makes it the way I like it so if I need to touch it up with the microwave later, so what. Four stars for taste.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best coffee makers I have ever had. I like the looks, the easily managed buttoms for programming and strength selection, and especially the taste of the coffee. The coffee remains hot enough for me to have my usual four cups in the morning for about 2 hours. It can be filled easily and does not spill when pouring. I use a Melitta brown filter and the grounds don't get into the coffee. I recommend this product to everyone who like a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: Not made for durability
customer_reviews.text: After slightly more than two years, I'm ready for this thing to just go away. It's slowly falling apart, and RUSTING. Coffee makers should last longer than this.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: This product works well and offers terrific value. The cone filters make better coffee than flat bottom filters. The thermal craft has a stainless steel internal liner, which is more durable than glass. It keeps coffee fresh & hot for 1-2 hours. You add water to the coffee maker by lifting the lid and pouring in water. Melitta recommends using the thermal craft to prevent overfilling. (There is a overflow hole in the back of the coffee maker, as well.)
customer_reviews.author: Steve Mac

customer_reviews.title: A great coffeemaker. I've had it for about a year ...
customer_reviews.text: A great coffeemaker. I've had it for about a year and it works exactly the way it's supposed to. An added plus, in my opinion, is the fact that the heating element comes on while the coffee is brewing and goes off when it's done. The thermos then keeps the coffee at the right temperature for an hour or more and never tastes old or burned. I've had many, many coffeemakers in the past 43 years and this is the best by far.
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: No need to spend more for a great maker.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing short of perfect. Simple design, easy to use and clean. No extra buttons, ultra quiet and best of all, no spills or drips while brewing or pouring !!! Coffee stays fresh for hours but if you need it piping hot after 2 hours, you will need to preheat the carafe. This is not a product flaw but epedemic to all thermos pots ive used. Would definately recommend to friends and family. Also, carafe lid removes simply and easily, opening a wide mouth for easy clean up, even for big hands. Kudos to Melitta, now lets just hope the internal electronics last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Melitta thermal coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and makes a great cup of coffee, stays hot for a long time, I didn't give it 5 stars because water level marks are very difficult to see and when filling it with water using the carafe you must pour fairly slowly or it goes all over, also rather awkward, the tab thing you push on the lid seems rather flimsy, worried about it lasting, and the filters don't seem to fit just right, bottom line great price for thermal and like the coffee so would recommend ..
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca F

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee ... no mess!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker makes a great cup of coffee with none of the mess of my previous coffee maker which frequently leaked all over the counter top. The only problem I had was that it was packaged without the filter basket which I got after calling Melitta who referred me to Hamilton Beach (the manufacturer). It then took about 10 days to get the part, but it been making great coffee ever since! The pot keeps the coffee hot and the lid is easier to get on and off than my previous pot.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Engstrom

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable, great quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from the Amazon discount warehouse (it had been returned, damaged packaging), for next to nothing as a house gift to a friend. I have an earlier version that I love, but this was so nice I thought of trading the two on my next visit. For all the reasons NOT to do so, I ended up not asking for the trade...but really only because I had forgotten mine at home. Buy this, it's the very essence of what a drip machine should be.
customer_reviews.author: Tailor Made

customer_reviews.title: The Best Cone Style Coffee Maker you will EVER find!!
customer_reviews.text: The Melitta's are the BEST coffee pots ever. I bought 2 as gifts. The strength of brew settings are FABULOUS!! I broke the glass carafe for my other one and you can get a new one from Hamiltonbeach.com Otherwise forget it. This thermal carafe is less destructible and keeps coffee hot for a few hours. The cone style is the ONLY way to brew perfect tasting coffee and this is going to satisfy even the pickiest coffee drinker. And I am picky!
customer_reviews.author: ZeldaRia

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor
customer_reviews.text: I love good coffee. And I just learned a new trick to clean calcification from the pot besides vinegar, you can use a teaspoon of mule team borax in the pot and it will erase all the stains. I was a bit concerned because I did not know if this would work as well as my previous coffee maker and I am one of those people who has to have my morning java. It really does work well and tastes good. I also grind my own beans every 2 days so usually my coffee is delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Violetwrites Leftow

customer_reviews.title: Only 8
customer_reviews.text: Miletta carafe brewer makes great coffee so why only 3 stars? If I fill the water level to 10 cups, it overflows all over my cabinet. It allows 8 cups just fine and so that's exactly what I do. Since we are big coffee drinkers it is disappointing to only be able to make 8 but ... The 8 cups are excellent and the carafe does a good job keeping the coffee hot!
customer_reviews.author: Pepper Morris-Pfiester

customer_reviews.title: Coffee is too cold for me
customer_reviews.text: I really researched this purchase after living with a dysfunctional coffee maker for several years. I wanted to love this model, and it does look great on my kitchen counter. But the carafe simply does not keep the coffee hot enough after about 20 min. I'm not a super-hot coffee fanatic either; a standard Mr. Coffee carafe at my office keeps it hot enough for me all morning. At home, I gave up and bought a Keurig....
customer_reviews.author: Amy Blake

customer_reviews.title: It's fine if you're just looking for a quick cup of "Joe"
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this coffeemaker is fine. Suggest that you don't try to sneak a cup before it's done brewing as the coffee will be cold. The full pot isn't overly hot. I have to remember to warm up my cup before I pour or else it has to go into the microwave for 15 seconds. It's easy to use and the brew strength button actually makes a significant difference in the end product. I've concluded that I need to try different coffees to find the one that's best for this coffeemaker. If you're particular about your coffee - always seeking out the perfect cup - this likely isn't the coffeemaker for you.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Geddes

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it in November 2013. It makes nice hot coffee & keeps it hot for a long time. My husband is happy with this coffee maker too. I really like the fact that it is a thermal coffee pot, I don't have to worry about glass breakage. If there is anything slightly negative about this coffee maker it is that it splatters a little when I pour the coffee. Perhaps I should pour a little slower.
customer_reviews.author: D Wright

customer_reviews.title: Family Sized Coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: This is all plastic just like my 10-year-old unit that finally expired, but this maker actually makes the coffee a little bit better than the old unit. I understand it is because is uses the large #4 paper filter which absorbs more of the bean acid than the smaller #2 filter used in the old unit. If you love your morning Joe and not interested in buying a $500+ coffeemaker for a great cup of coffee, you will not be disappointed in this unit.
customer_reviews.author: A. harley

customer_reviews.title: If you like cold coffee. . .
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had paid attention to the negative reviews here. The coffee is at a lower-than-drinkable temperature after it has just brewed, and the "thermal carafe" does nothing to keep it hot. A second cup has to be reheated in the microwave. I will be replacing it with something else (suggestions, anyone?) and wish I hadn't wasted money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jinpa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good coffee, a bit hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: This makes great coffee and auto-shuts off when the coffee is done. Leaving coffee on a heat source is the thing that kills the flavor and makes it nasty, so the thermal caraf is the perfect way to store your coffee. I am not liking how the lid for adding water and the lid for adding coffee grinds are linked (you cannot open the grind lid without opening the water lid). It is a bit hard to clean, though not much different from most models.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C

customer_reviews.title: Melitta 46894 10 Cup Thermal Coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: This is not a "grandma" coffee maker. I did not consider the weight of the thermal pot when full of coffee when I ordered it. I could not pick it up. There are lots of settings for coffee, but I could never get a good cup of coffee two days in a row !! I gave the pot to my grandson and it works just fine for him. Coffee stays hot if you rinse the pot with hot water just prior to making a pot.
customer_reviews.author: gramnancee

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in 90 days
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this coffee maker while it lasted. After 90 days it did not complete the brewing cycle. Sometimes, it would not pump the water, just turn it to steam; sometimes it would pump most of the water but not all. I cleaned it regularly, but before I gave up, I cleaned twice more per Mfgr instructions. Tried brewing a new pot and gave up after 52 minutes! Just purchased a Mr Coffee Thermal coffeemaker - Hope I have better luck
customer_reviews.author: arquad

customer_reviews.title: Ah, back to my Melitta
customer_reviews.text: I have had great experiences with Cuisinart coffee makers but this simple coffee maker fits me to a tee. Easy to learn how to use, adjust strengths of coffee. Best of all, the coffee carafe is the pot. Stays warm after 2 hours. Great savings in the cost. One tip, I only use distilled water as we have so many minerals in our water. All you get is pure coffee tasre.
customer_reviews.author: Rae L

customer_reviews.title: Ecellent product at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker worked perfectly. I had none of the issues others seemed to have had regarding spills, bad tastes, etc. The coffee was the perfect drinkable temperature, for me at least, and taste. This machine replaces my old Black & Decker. While that machine was pretty good, I always had issues with it. I'm sure this machine will keep me happy for a long time provided that it holds up. I think it's the best machine available at this price level.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph V Giunta

customer_reviews.title: Coffee is even good the next day
customer_reviews.text: THis thermal pot keeps the coffee from burning on a hot burner. It fits under my cabinets. I have been using it for years and it is still like new.
customer_reviews.author: Nanny

customer_reviews.title: Simple and keeps coffee HOT!
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a simple coffeemaker with an insulated carafe to keep the coffee hot. I have had several fancy expensive ones over the years that grind and brew etc.... I was always hanving problems with them leaking coffee, grinder would not grind well and the list goes on. I just wanted something simple. I did want a 12 cup, but settled for thie 10 cup. I love it so far. Very easy to use and my coffee stays hotter longer. I am hoping because this has no frills that this will last much longer then the last ones I have had.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Cuisinart with this product after reading reviews. I paid twice as much for the previous coffeemaker and was not as satisfied as with this one. I love the ability to make stronger coffee with the same or fewer grounds. I have been using the programmed start which I never did with my other coffeemaker due to the easy in setting it up. We have had it for about a month and I would certainly recommend it to a friend in need of this type product.
customer_reviews.author: geno

customer_reviews.title: Leaks all over the place, won't fill up th ecarafe
customer_reviews.text: Has all the features I wanted: programming, heat-retaining carafe, cone filter, but it leaks all over the place. The pause and brew does not work (just pours coffee straight down if you remove the carafe while the coffee is brewing). At first, I was at least getting half a pot out of it! Now, it just leaks all over and won't even push the water through the coffee. The water stays in the reservoir. I should have returned it to Amazon immediately, but I kept giving it a chance. Now I can't return it because it's been over 30 days. I will put it in the recycling bin today!
customer_reviews.author: la

customer_reviews.title: Excellent flavor and HOT coffee! Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Coffee comes out HOT and stays that way... At least thru bfast. Won't make any claims past that. That wasn't my goal... I had been doing some reading about "next generation" makers that brewed at higher temps, better flavor extraction, etc.. All true. I had purchased a Bonavita. 2-3x the money and NOT worth it. Funny cause the technology was supposed to be similar. That one went back the same day.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Seller Very Gracious and Professional.
customer_reviews.text: We returned the product because it didn't make HOT coffee. It made LUKEWARM coffee. We really wanted to like this because it is very attractive but didn't want to go through the back and forth of shipping another in case it didn't workout either. When they received the one we returned they called and asked if we wanted a refund or replacement. Great customer service. I will buy again from Today's Concept if given the chance.
customer_reviews.author: 1956Amanda

customer_reviews.title: ... to be very reliable with it making a consistently good pot of joe each morning
customer_reviews.text: BLUF - I've used this coffee maker everyday since I bought it from Amazon on 8 August 2012 and find it to be very reliable with it making a consistently good pot of joe each morning. Pros: Stainless steel pot, simple controls, relatively easy to clean. Con: The shape of the spout on the pot is such that dribbles very easily and spills even if you pour slowly, the burner/warmer on mine became rusty after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bond

customer_reviews.title: Great taste but with design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Brew strength selection is the best feature. I also appreciate that the coffee stays warm(for about an hour) without a warming plate that continues to cook the coffee and creates a bitter taste. The cons: the karafe is not designed well, I like to use the filtered water that comes from the refrigerator dispenser but due to the design it doesn't fit. It is also awkward to poor from the karafe, The blue light on the front display is too bright and takes away from an otherwise nice looking coffee maker. I would actually give it 3.5 stars, because the taste of the coffee is the most important but annoying design flaws bring down the rating.
customer_reviews.author: jayme Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great for RV
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our RV because of the stainless carafe. Don't have to worry about broken glass. I tried another brand, but it automatically turned off after brewing as the carafe was supposed to keep coffee hot, but it didn't. This unit has an auto shut off I think in 2 hrs, so it keeps the coffee hot and we don't have to worry about if we remembered to turn it off. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: chalkmtn

customer_reviews.title: Classy and good hot coffee
customer_reviews.text: The coffee is very good. We just leave the setting on robust. It is so quiet while it is brewing. Only thing that is difficult is to see the water mark when filling it...it is so pale and dark. I use a flashlight in early morning hours and even got out a magnifying glass! It would be so much better if the print were larger and more bold. Coffee stays very hot and that is great!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: It LEAKS!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this coffee maker, I've had it since 2013, has very nice features but the base leaks water. I've been using it while sitting on a towel to keep from making a mess. Today I decided it was enough, I pulled out an older maker that I will use till I can find one that I really want. It leaks from the bottom of the base...all over the counter!
customer_reviews.author: Shop savvy

customer_reviews.title: It makes good coffee!
customer_reviews.text: It was hard deciding what coffee marker to purchase--so many choices and so many reviews. I knew I wanted a thermal coffeemaker--that was probably the most important feature. There was a lot of negative reviews but people feel very strongly about their coffee. I purchased this and I really like it. My coffee is hot and stays hot for at least two hours. It makes good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Monstergrl

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffeemaker so far. Best feature IMO is that metal pot which I found after a few hours still keeps the coffee somewhat hot. Thankful that I read the other reviews here and chose to buy it. I will keep this updated as we use it. Feb 2016: Still working after 2 years and NO problems. I gave up on the Keurig and bought this and havent regretted it since.
customer_reviews.author: MellyMass

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good cup of coffee quickly!
customer_reviews.text: This Melitta coffee maker replaces another Melitta that was going strong after 6 years of daily use. I replaced it because I wanted a thermal carafe and this new one doesn't disappoint. The only issue is a slight plastic smell when pouring hot coffee after about a month of use but the Coffee tastes fine. At $59 it's good value for the price and looks great on my kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is the second carafe style coffee maker I have owned. I have also used a few other models that my family have. This brews excellent coffee and the carafe functions as it should. I prefer carafe over the standard glass because the coffee tastes worse the longer it sits with the burner going. The carafe on this machine is also very good compared to other Delonghi and Cuisinart models I have used. It pours well enough and doesn't spill all over the place like many other models manage to. I recommend this machine to anyone, especially now that I see the price has dropped even more. Get one! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Edwards

customer_reviews.title: The clock doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a coffee maker with a thermal carafe but didn't want to pay Cuisinart prices. This one fit the bill. It makes the coffee quickly and quietly. However, the clock doesn't keep the correct time for some reason. But since I'm retired and don't have to set it, that's ok. Clocks have nothing to do with making good coffee. But I gave it a four because the clock should work anyhow!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this coffee pot based on previous reviews and the specifications. My husband and I are picky about every aspect of coffee making but don't want to spent a fortune just to get a cup of joe either. The delivery was on time. The pot was exactly as pictured, easy to set up and easier to use. The water is heated to the optimum temperature to ensure the best brew and the cone filters help extract every drop of flavor. The coffee is strong without being acrid or bitter. And the thermal carafe keeps from "cooking" the final result. We are very happy with the product and would consider other Melittta products as a result of this positive experience.
customer_reviews.author: K. Field

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker. I love that the carafe is insulated so I can take the whole pot with me wherever I go! Seriously! Coffee on the porch anyone? Another plus: the burner turns off after brewing so the coffee doesn't burn & so you don't have to turn it off. I've used this AT LEAST once every day for just over 2 years now with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh Hill

customer_reviews.title: reall good product
customer_reviews.text: i am in love with my new coffee brewer --- i had a KRUPS for years but when it broke i could not ind the same model so I bought this one -- look is stylish , brew delicious coffee I love the setting (bold , strong and all ) so you can choose the strenght of your beverage. the clock still on at all time -- that blue clock looks really nice
customer_reviews.author: Flo

customer_reviews.title: Only 3 hours of HOT coffee
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the coffee hot for approximately 3.5 hours (at least for the temperature of my preference). I would of prefered the carafe being able to handle 12 cups instead of 10. Very simple to use and as one reviewer mentioned, finally a large opening to pour the water. I am not a coffee connoisseur, but I prefer this thermal coffeemaker to a traditional burner unit.
customer_reviews.author: Prietito

customer_reviews.title: Melitta 46894 Thermal Coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: We have had this coffeemaker since November 2012, replacing a Cuisinart Grind and Brew. We have had no problems with this machine after using it almost everyday since purchasing it. The coffee made with this unit is consistently good. It takes about 10 minutes for an 8 cup pot. The thermal carafe keeps the coffee hot for about 2 hours. All-in- all a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: DuneRunnerOBX

customer_reviews.title: Finally found our perfect coffeemaker.
customer_reviews.text: I love this Coffeemaker! It is simple, straight forward, and brews great coffee. The coffee is hot and stays hot with the thermos. I wanted a programable maker and this is easy to set. We have never had an "overflow" as other's have mentioned and I make coffee 1 to 2 times a day. It took a bit to find our perfect brew strength as the filters are different than we are used to but we love the flavor. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: E. N.

customer_reviews.title: Melitta 46894 Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product on August 21, 2012 and was initially quite happy with it however after 4 months the metal disc that the carafe sets on is rusting out. The part is not replaceable therefore the coffee maker will shortly be useless. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT as it is inherently defective. I am presently contacting Hamilton Beach to see if I can get a suitable replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Melitta 46894 10 Cup Coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffeemaker. It works very well, makes a nice hot cup of coffee. The insulated carafe keeps the coffee hot for about an hour. Mostly it is drunk pretty much right away anyway. It makes two cups just fine, since we rarely make more than that for the morning. The timer is easy to set up as well. Overall totally happy with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ralfk

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it makes a fine cup of coffee. We had this coffee maker for 4 years and then the heating element inexplicably died. But I'm ordering again. The coffee temp is hot enough - I have to wait for it cool before drinking, and it stays hot without cooking for several hours. The spout is a tad leaky, but fine. The programmer works, or you can brew coffee that's ready in about 1 minute per cup. As other reviews noted, it is tall and you have to lift the handle to get the basket to sit properly. Neither was a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Mitsuko R. Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the replacement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffeemaker after reading many glowing reviews, and it worked fine, at first. Although the brewing time was very slow, it made a great cup of coffee and the carafe kept it hot for a while. Unfortunately, the brewing time got longer and longer over the course of a month and a half, until finally the coffee maker shorted out and stopped even turning on - just past Amazon's return window, of course. When I contacted the manufacturer, I was pleased with the response: a new coffee maker was shipped to me within the week, and it seems to be more long-lived and working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect brew eveytime
customer_reviews.text: This is my first thermal coffeemaker and first Melitta. After almost a month I have to say I am very pleased with the quality and consistently well brewed cup of coffee! It took me a while to get used to NOT seeing how much coffee was left in the carafe, but the fact that the remaining coffee doesn't sit on a burner and become bitter is well worth it! I'm loving it!
customer_reviews.author: mary ann newton

customer_reviews.title: It's too bad, because it brews extremely well
customer_reviews.text: The carafe does not pour well. It drips coffee, which is messy. The basket also drips when the carafe is removed to pour, which means the hot plate also needs to be cleaned with every use. It's too bad, because it brews extremely well, especially dark roasts. I got tired of cleaning it, however, and mine has gone to good will.
customer_reviews.author: rtopping

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment if you are a coffee coniseur
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty and the charade is nice but no way this coffee is brewing at 190-200 degrees. I measured the temp and it was 170 and immediately fell to 160 and went down quickly thereafter. Those other reviews must be by Melitta. Keep looking! I'm returning. Makes a pretty flat coffee and I had to nuke in microwave. Melitta is going downhill in this model.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Melitta coffee maker 10 cup
customer_reviews.text: Aside from accidentally buying two and having to return one, this coffee maker is great. I had a Black & Decker with the cup type filter and it kept getting out of place and causing the water to overflow the basket and ended up with grounds in the pot. I purchased the metal basket that replaces the coffee filters and the Melitta coffee maker has been working just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D

customer_reviews.title: Way better than my old Mr. Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: When I dropped the glass decanter of my old Mr. Coffee, I decided to try something different. I bought this coffee maker based on the reviews. I love it. I especially like the stainless steel decanter. It keeps the coffee warm for a long time after the machine turns off. Be sure and run water through it the first time because the first batch tasted like plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Ipodcrazy

customer_reviews.title: favorite coffee brewer
customer_reviews.text: I have owned different coffee brewers over the years but this might be my favorite..especialy love the thermal carafe that keeps the coffee hot for a very long time...and bought the universal filter on Amazon too so don't have to use expensive paper coffee filters. We're very pleased with this purchase and the price was great! ($47)
customer_reviews.author: Linda Joy

customer_reviews.title: Coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: Actually I like the design and it makes a good cup of coffee but I have one complaint.I wish the coffee was hotter.The only way i solved the problem is to put boiling water in the thermal container for a few minutes before I brew the coffee.It keeps the coffee at a better temp.It a;so fits under the kitchen cabinets,many are too tall.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Happy morning coffee drinker
customer_reviews.text: I like this coffeemaker, it is stylish and I love the thermal carafe as it keeps coffee hot for hours ( no more reheating in the microwave). The only downside is the carafe only holds ten cups and sometimes I find this a bit small. Overall I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: crystal moore

customer_reviews.title: Well built and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, not enough on the market with stainless carafes. Two design flaws in my opinion, first is you have to open the coffee cap to open the water cap - not a big deal but strange and they sort of interfere with each other. Second is the lighted display never goes off. Otherwise well built and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Holograman

customer_reviews.title: Less than a year later needs replacing.
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker works fine. But we bought this Febuary 2013 and now, the area the carafe sits upon while the coffee is brewing is chipping, and corroding. I think water running down the carafe after filling or that has spilled while filling the coffee maker has caused the problem. Who makes sure the coffee carafe and base is dry before putting the carafe in place to brew? Now the bottom of the carafe gets dirty resting on the base and transfers to the tabletop. So now I'm looking for a new carafe coffee maker and will not buy this brand again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: great cone filter coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: We just replaced and old well used black and decker cone filter coffee pot with a Thermal carafe. It was a good one but falling apart. Bought a cuisenart thermal cone filter coffee pot from costco and it died. So thought we would try Melitta as it has been around for awhile and we love it. It actually makes coffee in three different strengths, is nice looking and easy to use. The coffee stays hot for hours. A bit pricey but worth it. Only had it a couple months so I hope it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee
customer_reviews.text: Amazon's service was great, as always. This is by far, best coffeemaker we have had. The stainless carafe keeps the coffee hot, but it never gets the "burnt coffee" taste that we got with other coffeemakers that used a hot plate type warmer. We always get compliments on our coffee and don't have to worry about breaking that fragile glass carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Good little coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: Makes a good cup of coffee, like the thermal carafe and it's easy to clean. It's easy to use and doesn't have any issues that I can tell. We got one of the Mr. Coffee optimal brews previously and and it compares to it, without the spillage issue of the Mr. Coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I made the decision to buy by reading reviews. I have been using this brewer daily for about 2 months now and I have had no issues. Brews Hot...stays hot for my daughter who has a cup an hour after me in the mornings.....no leaks of overflows (this only can happen if you fill past the 10 cup line on the side of the brewer or if you don't line up the basket. Coffee can still be warm 5 hours after the brew and makes a great iced coffee drink. Would definitely recommend. You can't pour a fast cup but if 5 seconds is too long for you....
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within 6 months. While it's under warranty ...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working within 6 months. While it's under warranty, the company charges $15.00 to have it repaired. If the product had lasted a few years, that may have been worth it. Order something with a longer shelf life. Our other coffee pot is 12 years old and still kicking!
customer_reviews.author: JJH

customer_reviews.title: Loved it for 7 months
customer_reviews.text: This was a great coffee pot. The timer was great. Hot java waiting for me every morning. Then it clogged up. A ten minute pot of coffee became a twenty minute pot of coffee, became a thirty minute , etc. Rinsed w vinegar about 5 or 6 times as the directions indicated. Nope. It's toast. It was a great 7 month run. And the water quality in Chicago is some of the best in the world, slightly basic, apparently enough particulate to fry the Melitta. I've had many coffee pots in my life. But I never had one that went belly up in 7 months. My advice - skip it.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang

customer_reviews.title: limited life span
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's just me' but I believe a quality product will last a bit longer than 3 years this is not one of them. worked great but then died after only 3 years
customer_reviews.author: Robin P

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a replacement for another one of these I'd had for several years that I loved. Almost immediately the plate started getting discolored from water/coffee drops. The other one was fine for several years before the discoloration started. The quality has changed over time. I love everything else about this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: OH Gal

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the best coffee makers I've ever owned up until about a month ago. I turned it on one day and instead of passing hot water through the grinds the water would just evaporate and never make it to the pot. It's less than a year old at this point and unusable as it no longer actually brews coffee. Not happy with the product and how quickly it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: This a good, not great, appliance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a previous brand "Other" I had. My only real gripe on this unit is that the temperature out of the brewer is a tad low, but the carafe's ability to keep coffee hot is terrible (and yes, I preheat the pot). After about 40 minutes, I must use the old microwave on my now warm, black coffee! Oh, I forgot; the display is WAY too bright! (picky, picky)
customer_reviews.author: oldsarge

customer_reviews.title: An improvement over the cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the cuisinart for about two years, but it continued to have leakage issues. When I was looking for a new coffee maker, I found many others had the same leakage issue. Based on the reviews, I purchased the Melitta. The Melitta, works fine, no leakage issues, and by pre-heating the caraffe before brewing, the coffee says nice and hot. No issues to date with this coffee maker. I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Valegill

customer_reviews.title: Paint peeling - Defective!
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for this coffee maker. Unfortunately the paint is peeling off from the warming plate after only two weeks of use! I see now that others have complained about their warming plate rusting - I bet this is the same defect. I guess I can now boast that I make coffee so strong that it can peel paint. HA! I do NOT recommend this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: E. Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The Melitta 46894 coffee maker is awesome and we have went through the ringer trying to find the right one. We are very picky and returned 6 in this price range ($60-$80) so far. This product satisfies all that we require in a coffee maker: cone filter, thermal carafe, and brew strength selector. Look no further than this beauty trust me!
customer_reviews.author: Samubus

customer_reviews.title: Burn out!
customer_reviews.text: We'd been looking for another thermal coffeepot so were happy to get this one, which arrived in good condition and made a super hot pot of coffee. Unfortunately, it burned out quickly! So I'm back to using a cheap, glass pot coffeemaker, but as soon as it's ready, I pour it into this easy-to-use thermal pot.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: What I expected!
customer_reviews.text: First off let me say the reviewers that say the coffee is not hot are wrong. And that the coffee cools too much after being in the thermal carafe. I find that the the thermal carafe no better or worse than other thermal carafes I've had. the coffee stays hot but the last cup or 2 should be warmed in the microwave for about 20 seconds. it is no different than others I've had. Water line is easy to see and easy to fill. Timer works so I have nothing bad to say about it, and it's reasonably priced. It makes great coffee, and I like the 3 settings.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Duba

customer_reviews.title: Good brewer.
customer_reviews.text: When I have company and need to make more than just a single serve (see the AeroPress for a proper individual cuppa), this does the job. Heats to the proper temperature and brews the coffee right. Display is a tad bright, as others have complained... er, described. But it's in the kitchen. Who sleeps there??
customer_reviews.author: Jim

product_meta.title: Melitta 46894 10-Cup Thermal Coffeemaker
feature_bullets: Regular, bold and robust settings for rich-tasting coffee
Cone filter design for better coffee extraction
